replies.body: **C9 BELIEVE**

I'm a TSM fanboy, and even I think that putting Fnatic above C9 is a joke, even with hai STILL not at 100%.  Hoping to see how lemon and lustboy counterplay against a nautilus in the finals though.  Ought to be a good Bo5.
FINALLY. A TSM fanboy who can politely talk about C9!

I like tsm more than c9 mainly because of the mid lane bjergsen and hai. I just haven't seen much from hai in the mid lane while bjergsen is a star. I'm not sure how hai isn't at 100% yet it's been about a year. I honestly believe that people just figured out how to counter hai
Recovery from his lung collapse right before the Summer Split last year and now injured wrists. He's never been the best of laners, but he has a ton of stuff taking toll on him.

I think Fnatic is better team than C9. The individual players are better /maybe except Meteos-Reignover, not sure/, Fnatic has excelent teamfights and strong lanephase. Could you explain why is Fnatic>C9 a joke? They havent played against each other and the analysts analyzed ( -.- ), that Fnatic is probably better. Thats all. 

Also: if Fnatic wins EU and TSM wins NA, then C9 will be even more lower. If Fntic will be the EU champ and C9 the NA champ.. well, idk. Probably they will be all very close to each other. 

PS: if someone isnt 100% in the half of the season... well, thats not good.

"They will probably all be very close to each other. No... just no. TSM are looking like beasts right now and would wreck, just wreck Fnatic if they went head to head. If C9 is on their game they are better than TSM so they are definitely better than Fnatic.

It's plain and simple. If the C9 that lost the first to games to Liquid shows up, Fnatic are better. If it's the C9 who beat TSM (week 9) and then went 3/0 on Liquid... if they turn up they are the best team in the west. 

EU is just behind NA this year
I really hope PaWn gets well for the MSI. :(
Assuming his team gets there without him

Rather sick of all of the TSM Fanboying. IEM Katowice is TSMs first internationally won competition. They didn't face CJ or GE in any meaningful matchup (Best of 1s show nothing and should be valued as such). They faced a team that GE under-estimated and likely completely ignored. Which shows no-team can do that.

This is going to be downvoted, but honestly I could careless. Anyone expects TSM to win MSI, prepare to have that expectation dashed and thrown away.

The circle jerk that is TSM Fanboying has always been around, but since Katowice it has gotten even more absurd. You can call me a hater, but I would rather be called, Vix. ;)

I spend a lot of time on these forums, sure I talk about TSM, but I talk about 189729712987219872019781289071289 other things as well. I don't hate TSM, I don't particularly like them either, but the sheer number of rejects on the forums that will post "TSM" only or "TSM r da bezt though" and be completely serious is asnine in the best/WBC worthy ignorance in the worst.

I don't know where the religious implications have a place in this conversation, but I don't agree. Blindly following a team is good and all but shoving that team down the throats of everyone else and calling them "haters" when they don't drink the koolaid, is kind of ridiculous.

I agree, I don't understand why people can't see compromise in TSM, it's either they suck or are #1 huehuehue. I myself am not a huge TSM fan but are they a more relevant international  team now than before? Yes. Will they go to MSI? I think so. Will they win MSI? No.

I'm a die-hard TSM fanboy but I can find compromise on them. The problem TSM fans get sometimes though is people needlessly hating on the team or just crapping all over their accomplishments. 

IEM was a fantastic accomplishment for not only TSM but for NA as a whole as well. We FINALLY got a International LAN win. I feel like TSM will win this Sunday (3-1) and do well at MSI. I don't think they'll do win but they'll get to Semis. 

As far as Worlds go? TSM and C9 have pretty much already locked in their spots with their Championship Points and I feel like both can get to Quarters again. Maybe even Semis. Will they win? Probably not, but not having faith that they'll do as good or better than last year isn't going to help. You have to have faith in your region.

Intelligent conversation about TSM! Well, this is exciting!

I completely agree with the sentiment that a team can be good but not necessarily the greatest. I'm a self-proclaimed Curse (now TL) fan, but I know they aren't going to go out and win worlds.

Thank you for the reasonable and understanding comment. It's refreshing.

I'm a TSM fan but people are stupid to believe that they are the best sure they are a great team but not the best. I do feel they are a bit underanked though. But the people who you are talking about who think iem is everything need get on with it and see what happens at msi. Will see if tsm is the real deal there or if they still need improvement

The people that think IEM is everything are the most likely to rage about NA > EU. I don't see how you can contribute an entire region to a single team. Or proclaim a team isn't in the region they play for because of their birthplace.

Its all mindless anyways. Some EU teams are better than NA. Some NA are better than EU. Some NA/EU teams are > CN teams. It is team by team. Not region vs region.

Thank you for the wonderful commentary.
It's very simple, TSM are a group of nice, likable and talented young guys. That's it. End of Story.

I don't really mind  if You like the team itself or not.

What i want you to understand is that TSM fans have the hardest time showing their love, because they instantly get cussed on and are considered as a member of a crowd without real opinion. I know you probably meant the crowd guys only and respect the rest, but just look at this comment section for example. A single guy saying "TSM FO LIFE" or something (i assume because didn't find anything else so disturbing here) pissed you off so much you felt the urge to post something against them. Meanwhile "C9 BELIEVE" is getting 50+ upvotes and no one is bitching about it.

The reason why there are more people saying TSM after IEM is that they have Something finally to root for, Something good that came from the west. I think it's natural and they shouldn't be considered as braindead monkeys. Were you this mad about the guys who were hyped about C9 when it was their prime too?

>tsm had proved there dominance repeatedly i dont understand how they can be put so low like 7 they deserve at least 5

>Solomid should atleast be ranked number 5 considering they have beaten that team at that power ranked smh.

And that is just some of the mindless comments on this thread, my comment overall was about TSM Fanboi's (yes I spelled it like that because I'm specifying a specific group within the TSM Fandom) and not just about this thread.

I'm not mad, I am expressing a thought to the rest of the people on this thread. That some of the people in the TSM fandom completely forget logic and place TSM on a pedestal they likely don't deserve.

I'm sorry the poor TSM Fans feel persecuted by a single comment thread on a Power Rankings, but they will get over it because TSM is one of the most recognized names in LoL Esports. And once again, everything I have said is about a particular set of fans and not all TSM fans in general.

+1 for intelligent discussion
-1 for missing the point of the discussion.

If you need more incentive read this beautiful response by Mitchbear7 (he's a real MVP):
>I agree, I don't understand why people can't see compromise in TSM, it's either they suck or are #1 huehuehue. I myself am not a huge TSM fan but are they a more relevant international team now than before? Yes. Will they go to MSI? I think so. Will they win MSI? No.

and TrollFan01 (who can be a Real Hero even though he's my Arch-Nemesis):
>I'm a die-hard TSM fanboy but I can find compromise on them. The problem TSM fans get sometimes though is people needlessly hating on the team or just crapping all over their accomplishments.
>
>IEM was a fantastic accomplishment for not only TSM but for NA as a whole as well. We FINALLY got a International LAN win. I feel like TSM will win this Sunday (3-1) and do well at MSI. I don't think they'll do win but they'll get to Semis.
>
>As far as Worlds go? TSM and C9 have pretty much already locked in their spots with their Championship Points and I feel like both can get to Quarters again. Maybe even Semis. Will they win? Probably not, but not having faith that they'll do as good or better than last year isn't going to help. You have to have faith in your region.

It has no religius purpose, it was just some overexaggerated thing as comparison. Not meant to hate despite using an arrogant attitude.

I'm just so confused that i read about 5 comment hating TSM "fans" for 1 of the actual things that you've just said. Maybe it's just the way how people differ in what things get in their attention.

The another reason is that i started to Really like TSM since S4 worlds, as they have the most hope to bring glory to the west, and they convinced me at IEM (ok, no koreans beaten in bo5, but you beat who you get to beat and it's not their fault they didn't get them) and with their always-wanting-to-improve attitude.

However, "haters" seem to post exponancially more posts since IEM, (i mean ridiculous things like TIP will beat them easy and so on) instead of just being happy.

So i got this hater hater attitude recently, I replied you after seeing your comment about c9 beating them (which is possible, but i thought you're just another mean troll). Anyways, sorry.

The World Elite that went to IEM Katowice and the team since, is not the team that was tied for last place in LPL. The team has been absolutely wrecking past few weeks making a cindarella run to qualify for LPL playoffs and almost taking down what is largely considered the best team in the world right now, Edward Gaming. Spirit is a ridiculously good jungler and Xiye has been stepping up insanely since joining the team. World Elite is not a bad team by any means.
Not to menation that mystic was a huge step up from their other AD carry. He is looking really impressive in what is probably the most competitive AD carry region.

>  it could be a mid lane fan's dream -- Faker, Westdoor, Bjergsen, Febiven, and Pawn could all plausibly be at the same event, and be forced to play one another.

OMG PLEEEAAASSEEEE
As exciting it would be, as a jungler I want UOL to go to MSI in hopes Kikis pulls out some more unused picks
TSM/UOL REMATCH!

UoL / C9 Rematch! 

These aren´t your preseason Horny Ponies...  :P

the only Legend that could really make this MSI more exciting is Xpeke, too bad he wont be there though, they only just qualified for LCS  :P, faker vs xpeke is easily one of the best matchups to watch (Seeing as during ALL stars even when FNC was tilting a little peke won faker kass vs zed) and xpeke always brings the A game against big name mid laners like dade and faker, would be entertaining  dont you agree? :)
so how did peke win lane? faker had a big cs lead, like 20 at 15 minutes and all the kills for both laners camer from skrimishes between the teams

xpeke had the cs lead for as long as they were in lane, faker started split pushing like zeds do. not pekes fault that zed vs kass is a an awful matchup for kassadin. faker fan boys need to realize that just because faker is VERY talented. that doesnt mean there arent players as good as he is, xpeke has proven time and again that everytime anyone counts him out they have made a terrible mistake. they are at either equal levels of skill or very very close. most of you wont get your out of the clouds long enough to see that
Peke vs dade huehuehue
Just watch SKT play easyhoon to screw us all over

Cant belive that SK is better than H2K(here is my opinion FNC>H2K>UOL>SK).
At the end of this split and even in playoffs against FNC they showed that they are better now(if we compare with the beggining of Spring split) and I think that H2K will pull at least a 3-2 win against SK.

P.S:This is my opinion.

Totally agree. 
I really don't understand the reasoning behind the european rankings.
And removing H2K from the top 20 international ranking is just bullshit.

Rito Logic. Since SK didn't play against H2K, they are obviously inferior. Which is dumb because I think H2K is a top 2 team EU. (Pr0lly is awesome).

SK's lack of functional diversity (1-3-1 comps are their only comps) and poor vision games should only give them 4th at best. So I agree with DGrayMaN2
They're likely ranking SK above because they're still taking into account the overall season. Regardless we'll see on Saturday whether or not H2K is the better team

Team SoloMid vs Cloud 9 The matchup of the NA LCS finals has returned once again. This series will be determined on whether Hai can hold off Bjergsen and which bot lane gets the upper hand. That being said, Fnatic vs Unicorns of Love is going to be a great series as well, Personally I hope the Unicorns win because I like them as a team, and I would love to see them at MSI.

Hold on to your seats folks... we are going to have some epic Bo5's

On a side note, I really hope someone pulls out {{champion:112}} , that would make my day

Here are my predictions for who is attending MSI:

LPL - EDG
LCK - SKTT1
NA - TSM
EU - FNC
LMS - AHQ (duh)
Wildcard - DtN FM

I really want C9/UOL to make it to MSI, but it doesn't seem likely, with how inconsistent these teams have been.
TSM is going to win their 5th Regional title and represent NA at MSI.
and get crash by korea and china? pretty cool bro.
Yea because IEM Katowice didn't just happen a few weeks ago or anything. TSM clearly can't beat Chinese and Korean teams

oh let me see, did tsm have beaten any korean teams in a bo5? not at all bro, and beating a 11th place lpl team means a lot? cool bro.  TSM FANS just cant learn. all the international events final have been korea vs china, and clearly it will still be same in the future. lol

Did TSM beat the team that eliminated BOTH Korean teams? You say TSM fans can't learn? More like TSM HATERS can't move on and realize that Western teams are getting better and TSM has improved. 

Cool story bro. Keep hating and never having fun.
TSM are not even going to MSI. C9 will clench the Finals and it will be them at MSI.
Yo buddy, you made a typo. You wrote "TSM" when you meant "C9" and then wrote "C9" when you meant "TSM"
Hey Guy, I'm not your buddy. I wrote what I meant. No typo there.
Why the hostilities? We're not enemies, just guys with different opinions and favorite teams.
... Team WE is hardly a eleventh place team more like 3rd or 4th they just went 2-3 vs edg. I know pawn wasn't in for some of the games but still edg was said to be miles ahead
More like 5/6 (out of 12)
i am still enjoying watching TSM getting crash by china and korea in the past.
